item.title: Adding objects (if you tell me i'll rep++ u)
item.dc:creator: @doodooss doodooss
item.description:
@doodooss wrote:

uhh i havent messed with it much

but i think u go into client.java
and find this

addglobalobj

and u should c this

  public void AddGlobalObj(int objectX, int objectY, int NewObjectID, int Face, int ObjectType) {
    //for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
    //Linux (java 1.4.2-compatible) change - JordanScape
    for (int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.players.length; i++) {
      //changed
      Player p = server.playerHandler.players[i]; //changed
      if (p != null) {
        client person = (client)p;

        if (person.playerName != null) {
          if (person.distanceToPoint(objectX, objectY) <= 60) {
            person.ReplaceObject2(objectX, objectY, NewObjectID, Face, ObjectType);

          }
        }
      }
    }
  }

add this under person.replaceobject2

            AddGlobalObj(//xcoords, //ycoords, //objectid, //direction facing, 10);

im not promising this will work[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 09, 2007, 09:23:16 PM[/size][hr]did it work?

Read full topic

public void NewObjects() no work

[quote author=snowycards link=topic=222521.msg1923419#msg1923419 date=1197267271]
look for this makeGlobalObject in client.java

until you see something like this makeGlobalObject(2606, 3104, 2874, 0, 10);//strength train

then press enter, and follow this format makeGlobalObject(coordsX, coordsY, objectID, 0, 10);
[/quote]no work ether

Then underneath it has;

AddGlobalObject(2803, 9205, 11758, -3, 10);//bank booth

and so on and so forth.[/quote]
